meanings.sent1: The workers were rubberising the handles of the tools to make them easier to grip.
meanings.sent2: She rubberised the bottom of her shoes to prevent slipping on wet surfaces.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to rubberise the edges of the cutting board to prevent it from sliding around the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The idea of rubberising the playground to make it safer for children was met with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: After rubberising the seams of the tent, they were confident it would stay dry during the storm.

meanings.definition: To make something resistant to water or other liquids by applying rubber.
meanings.sent1: Rubberising the fabric of the raincoat helped keep the wearer dry in the downpour.
meanings.sent2: The company started rubberising their packaging to protect the products during shipping.
meanings.sent3: The idea of rubberising the picnic blanket seemed odd at first, but it kept spills from ruining the outing.
meanings.sent4: She felt like rubberising her phone case would make it waterproof like a submarine.
meanings.sent5: The old boots were given new life after rubberising them to make them water-resistant.

meanings.definition: To cover or treat with rubber in order to make something more durable or flexible.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter was rubberising the edges of the table to prevent wear and tear.
meanings.sent2: Rubberising the joints of the pipes helped prevent leaks in the plumbing system.
meanings.sent3: The idea of rubberising the edges of the book cover made it more bendable and sturdy.
meanings.sent4: She thought of rubberising the wheels of her suitcase to make it more shock-absorbent.
meanings.sent5: The tailor suggested rubberising the seams of the jacket to increase its longevity.
